knimeNode.name: Grid Coverage Analyzer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Divide a geographic zone into a grid and see how often each rectangle was visited.

fullDescription.intro: The node calculate a grid in the specified input zone using the given number of rows and columns. It then proceeds to assign each valid entry in the input table to a specific grid cell as a visit. A visit is considered valid if it means a change of rectangle for the route owner, or if the time between the current visit and the previous one was more than the specified number of minutes in the input dialog. The node offers two output tables, one considering the whole input data-set and the other separating the information by day.

ports.inPort:
The input data must contain the following information:
owner_id, an integer representing the route step owner.
begin_at, a LocalDateTime containing information on the moment at which the route step began.
end_at, a LocalDateTime containing information on the moment at which the route step finished
the_geom, a String representation of a route formatted as WKT Linestring
ports.outPort: Information on how often a rectangle was visited broken down by day and by time slow within a day.
Information on how often a rectangle was visited.
